action: I want to safely integrate data with external systems such as accounting, inventory, and CRM
reason: To automate the exchange of business data and prevent manual input errors and operational delays
acceptance_criteria: External integration APIs are only available to authenticated clients.
API usage requires an issued API key or OAuth authentication.
API keys are stored as hashes.
A revocation function for API keys must exist.
API key usage status is recorded in logs.
IP restriction settings for API access are possible.
Communication is permitted only via HTTPS.
Only secure TLS versions are permitted.
API requests are received in JSON format.
Content-Type verification is enforced.
Requests with invalid formats return a 400 error.
A maximum request size limit is set.
Rate limiting is applied (Anti-DoS).
Authorization checks are performed on a per-endpoint basis.
Data access control is enforced according to roles.
Parameterized queries are used as SQL injection countermeasures.
Input values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Data received from external sources is saved to the DB only after validation.
Registration fails if mandatory fields are missing.
Errors occur if data types do not match.
DB update processes are under transaction control.
A mechanism exists to prevent duplicate registration of the same data.
Update conflicts are detected via optimistic locking.
Success logs for integration processing are stored.
Error logs for integration failures are stored.
Logs include External System ID and timestamp.
Logs are stored in audit-specific storage.
API responses return standard HTTP status codes.
Internal information is not returned even during a 500 error.
Retry control mechanisms exist.
Timeout settings exist.
Supports batch integration using asynchronous processing queues.
Supports Webhook integration.
Webhook signature verification is implemented.
API versioning is managed.
Backward compatibility is considered for each version.
API specifications (OpenAPI/Swagger) are provided.
Monitoring of API usage status is possible.
Alerts occur upon detection of abnormal access.
Data encryption at rest is applied (Personal Information Protection).
Data masking functionality exists.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Target API response time is within 1 second.
Design ensures no processing delays even under high load.
